page.title: 05Environment
page.content: Situated at the northern end of the Chilternsthe area is clay with flints on chalk. A 126 acre woodland site of Special Scientific Interest lies within this area of outstanding natural beauty.The high environmental quality of the area and easy access to the M1, Luton, Dunstable and the towns of north-west Hertfordshire attract the retired and high income commuters. The area is mainly agricultural with woods and commonland. Studham, Bedfordshire's southernmost village, is the largest in the block. Dunstable Road runs between terraced brick houses, numbers 5-9 being a conservation area. The two shops are over 100 years old, the Post Office was originally the village bakery. To comply with Local Planning Authority aims, new houses are screened by trees.
